page.title: 12Scalford Creamery
page.content: Now owned by a large Midlands concern, the Creamery produces only{Blue {Stilton}cheese,in an old stone building,previously a local brewery. It provide employment for 6 full time and 4 part time local workers. The cheese is made by first heating milk to pasteurise it, killing any germs.Rennet is added making the mixture stiffen into curds.The waste liquid, whey is sold for pigfood. Some germs, needed to make cheese, are sprayed back in, the curd is ground in a mill,put into hoops and left for four days until the cheese can stand by itself. The cheese must be left for about 10 weeks before it is ready to eat.The blue veins are made by inserting needles so that air can get in. About 100 cheeses are made like this every week each weighing about 7k.g.
